website_summaries.verdict: An affordable waterproof dry bag that does what it's supposed to do as long as you follow the directions.
pros: Floats on water if it goes overboard
Detachable shoulder strap and handle for carrying
cons: May leak if not rolled correctly to seal out moisture
Make sure you follow directions before using

customer_reviews.title: 5L bag
customer_reviews.text: I have the 5l bag. Bought 2 5l and a 10l. We haven't used our bags yet but we've tried out the phone protectors. They do their job. Hardest part I had about picking the right size bag was I didn't have a visual reference for how big they are so I'm including a pic of my 5l it holds my camera a water bottle and a small towel with some room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Sara M. W.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and GREAT quality!!
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT size!! I love this dry bad and didn't even realize it came with an additional clear dry bag for my phone! We've taken it out on the kayak a few times and there is never any water that gets inside and no condensation that builds up inside like other dry bags I've bought in the past. We went with a smaller size because we wanted a bag specifically for electronics, and the range of sizes made it really easy to choose the right one.
customer_reviews.author: Meaghan C.

customer_reviews.title: Love these bags
customer_reviews.text: Love these bags! We jetski and these work perfect for the compartments! I got a 10ml and 20ml. We ended up returning the 10ml and ordering a 30ml. For the 20ml I easily fit a small beach towel, sandals, change of clothes, and had room left for few other goodies. The 10ml would fit a towel, flip flops (sneakers didn’t fit well), and a few other items but it was snug. I decided to get the 30ml to have extra room and pass down the 20ml to my husband who doesn’t pack as much :P
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: just in time for river tubing
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my grandson for his tube run down the Guadalupe River. The "5" was perfect size for carrying everything he needed--phone, keys, water bottle, snack, dry shirt, sunglasses and sunscreen. Its strap could be hooked to the rope around the sides of the tube to secure it from being lost in the rapids. And the bright color made it easy to see. All in all, perfect!
customer_reviews.author: life is fun

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product. Literally saved my life.
customer_reviews.text: I can officially attest that after my float trip this was by far the best Amazon purchase I have ever made. Our canoe was dragged under trees by rapid water. I was stranded on a tree waiting for help and was able to easily find this bag (I bought the bright green one) floating by me. I grabbed onto it and it kept me afloat through the rest of the rapids till I reached the bank. When I looked inside everything was perfectly dry. We had our phones, wallets, car keys everything valuable in this bag. If I could give this product 100 stars I would. Thanks for your great product, you have a fan for life!!
customer_reviews.author: Alyson

customer_reviews.title: Great bag and the cell phone pouch is amazing too
customer_reviews.text: Great bag and the cell phone pouch is amazing too! I tested it the same night it arrived with a real phone and in my shower. The phone survived! In case you're wondering a 5 liter bag, is more or less the same size as your average tan packaging envelope but more cylindrical.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Would Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I got the 10L one due to the reviews suggesting this as a good size. I was looking to keep some smaller kayaking supplies, as well as my non-waterproof valuables and perhaps a towel/socks/etc. The material is more rubbery than I thought, but just as a waterproof bag should be. It does have a strong odor of rubber, but I like it so that's not a complaint (haha). I bought this over the winter, so living in New England hasn't allowed me a chance to use this product yet, but I like what I see so far
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Rubber Material, Nice
customer_reviews.text: I gave a 4 only because I haven't had it in the water yet. Appears to be nearly indestructible heavy rubber material which holds its shape fairly well. Looks like it will work well. Oh yeah, the photo in the product description shows what appears to be a phone type PD next to the product. This is just a heavy rubber name tag holder.
customer_reviews.author: S.M.Dadd

customer_reviews.title: Great dry bag.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first dry bag, which I bought to keep on my sunfish sailboat. I bought it so I could bring a few things with me while I sailed on a small boat that easily capsizes, and get a fair amount of water in it. Once I received the bag, I immediately put it to the test. I am a guy after all. So, filled up the sink, put some napkins in the bag, closed it up, and pushed it underwater. It worked perfectly! I am very please with it!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Good product/price
customer_reviews.text: This bag (5L) was a good size for essentials (for me it was a rain jacket, phone, wallet, and some food) during a day on the water. I seemed to roll down and seal tightly, the seams were nicely done, and while it didn't end up in the water everything stayed dry during several consecutive day trips in a very wet boating environment.
customer_reviews.author: RRuebs

customer_reviews.title: Need to get used to it
customer_reviews.text: It was different from what I used before, so I was a little bit puzzled but you roll the top part and then clip the both ends together to "seal" the top. It did not completely seal for me for the first couple tries but I realized that if we take the air out as much as we can, then it closes better. I liked the air in the bag in case our kayak tip over so the bag will float. But we just need to take the air out for a better seal and tie the bag to my kayak to not lose it.
customer_reviews.author: Surf Cal

customer_reviews.title: It leaked!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter purchased this bag for a tubing trip down the Salt River in Arizona...her comments were, and I quote "We did not use this product right away, as it was for a special trip. Unfortunately the item did not work well for us at all. In fact, I am quite glad that I didn't trust it to its full capacity as it leaked. And when I say 'leaked' I mean I dumped out about a liter of water from it. - Chelsea Sullivan "
customer_reviews.author: 52mum

customer_reviews.title: Love this bag!
customer_reviews.text: Great price for an even better product! This little bag is great; we bought the 10L and it fits everything we need. Two changes of clothes, snacks, and supplies; or it can hold two large beach towels and a few supplies. It does a great job at protecting your stuff as well. Our raft flipped in the ocean and the bag floated safely to shore with everything still dry inside.
customer_reviews.author: Sahara T.

customer_reviews.title: Great for 6-day rafting trip
customer_reviews.text: 30L works great with the backpack style straps. If you are deciding between 20 or 30L, go with 30...you'll probably need the space. You have to roll the top several times to waterproof, so it takes some space off the top. 20L is good for small amount of "day use" items, but not storage for overnight. We bought a second at 40L for extra space.
customer_reviews.author: vicki

customer_reviews.title: You cannot go wrong with this dry bag!
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased two of these. They are of the highest quality. I feel comfortable keeping my emergency items in these. The first one I bought we took on a kayak trip. We kept our emergency supplies in there (things like food, first aid, emergency tent, blankets, ponchos...etc. I kayak with my 90 pound lab so you can be sure we got wet during the trip. My emergency stuff???? dry. Love this product, well worth the money to trust your supplies are kept dry. Bobbie Olsen
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Great product, waterproof as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use, worked as advertised! No water made its way within the bag over a 4 hour river tubing. Only regret is buying the bag in black, bad idea for a product to use for long periods of time in the sun. Interior of the bag gets very hot, would recommend buying a lighter color. This is no fault of the seller. Great product, would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: OneThirtySeven

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof!  Be careful and do not purchase if you need 100% Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Not 100% waterproof! I purchased three of them for use in the storage area of a Sea-Doo watercraft. One of them cost me a new phone... I waited about 30 days before I added my review... I wanted to see if they were truly waterproof and if they would hold up. Product looked great out of the package and appeared to hold up the first two weeks... Following the first two weeks the seams started to leak; one seam appeared to come unglued and now all three gather moisture when water is present.... I would not rank these as waterproof but rather water resistant at best.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Great foul weather bag!
customer_reviews.text: 20 liter bag purchased as a bag for carrying everything needed for outdoor track meets, which go on rain or shine. First weekend we used it, the team tent flooded out and everyone's gear was soaked, except my son's, which was dry as could be. Thank you Unigear! You will likely be receiving more orders from my son's other team members now!
customer_reviews.author: D.L.

customer_reviews.title: Great dry bag for kayaking
customer_reviews.text: This is my first dry sack. I ordered the 20L one and I love it!! It fits an outfit and a towel and other odds and ends. I love that the handle has clips. I use the handle to clip my small cooler to my kayak. No issues so far. The phone cover also works great. Sometimes it picks up glare spots with the sun but maybe I didn't have the lens against the plastic. I still love the pictures I got anyways. I attached an image I took using the phone cover
customer_reviews.author: C. Durfee

customer_reviews.title: Case won't fit newer phones, get 5L+, 2L will only hold a small bottle or condoms or tampons.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. These are child sized, get at least 5L. Phone case will not fit newer longer phones, the 2L doesn't even fit phones with cases. Quality seems high, and the army green color looks great, no fake rain drops like the pic thank goodness. I will probably try to use the phone case for my wallet or loose change and the dry bag for candy or other smaller items. Most likely both items will go in the bottom of a box, passed off to relatives or donated. 2L keep dreaming, you will get maybe a soda can into the bag once folded. They are both worthless to me, I wish I had never ordered them.
customer_reviews.author: Sleepsmith

customer_reviews.title: Bag is bigger than expected
customer_reviews.text: This bag is awesome, and made of a heavy duty fabric, which feels almost like the material of a raft ot innertube. It is larger than we were expecting, which in my mind is a bonus. This will be great for swimsuits as well as wet towels at the beach. It also comes with a clear cell phone case to prevent your phone from getting wet, while still being able to use it. Would absolutly purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C.

customer_reviews.title: Great bags!
customer_reviews.text: This is our third one, they're great! Keep things dry and you can cram a bunch of stuff in there. Our bags have been whitewater rafting, a week backpacking the boundary waters, and in a couple of weeks will go down to sea base. Everyone has their own, and with all the colors to choose from, it's really easy to tell them apart!
customer_reviews.author: Andi

customer_reviews.title: When used properly, works great! Phone case too!
customer_reviews.text: Pro tip: trap air in bag to create a balloon, keep snap closure on top to apply downward pressure. Worked great! Kept everything dry. Took it to all the water activities and submerged in the pool. A bit small after rolling, enough for small valuables such as phones, wallet, etc. If you want to keep shoes, socks, and clothing dry, buy a bigger size! Even the phone case was good, but the newer model, which we also bought was a better product. It was much easier to take photos; videos was tricky to activate.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C

customer_reviews.title: Follow the directions and it works well.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this bag on about 20 float trips with no issues. It's never been submerged, but it works well for splashing and it should give you an opportunity to retrieve it if does goes overboard. Squeeze out the air and then roll the top thre times before locking and you're good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Outskiing

customer_reviews.title: Well made and tough dry bag for all your important gear.
customer_reviews.text: This is not your lightweight Walmart dry bag. These are heavy and well made and will last a long time even with heavy use. I've bought the cheaper versions from the big box store and learned my lesson. Now I know that if I want to keep my gear dry and safe, this is the way to go. I have several and have my entire camp setup in one bag and my underquilt and over quilt in another. I also have some smaller bags for cooking gear and food storage. These are well made and will last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Dale E East

customer_reviews.title: A great bag all around!
customer_reviews.text: We are new power boat and kayak owners, so I have been looking for a good 5L dry bag to throw our stuff in when we boat, or cram in under the bungees when I kayak. The snap-roll-click closure has kept everything dry, I was able to select a color I wanted (so nice not to have to take default in these Coronavirus days), and the shoulder bag makes it easy to secure to the golf cart. All around a very easy to use bag in a wide variety of sizes that performs as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: S in Indy

customer_reviews.title: Great 5l bag - serves its purpose
customer_reviews.text: 5L is a good size for a DSLR with a zoom lense, phone, sunscreen, keys and a long sleeved t-shirt. I have it between my legs while kayaking so I can pull out my camera and take photos. I have not submerged it in water but it at least keeps the contents dry when it is splashed, which is quite a bit and after sitting in a puddle of water in the bottom of the kayak. It folds down easily and the strap is great for carrying, if I stop and decide to hike. Well work the money to keep my camera dry.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for the lake but haven’t had a chance to use it due to the current health precautions. I did test it out in the sink and it is in fact waterproof!! You can easily fit a phone, some cash, a small speaker and suntan lotion in the small size waterproof bag. The phone case is water proof as well, although I found myself pressing harder to use the buttons. Overall great product and keeps your things dry
customer_reviews.author: Takiah

customer_reviews.title: best investment ever
customer_reviews.text: I received the 10L bag in a timely manner. I was a little worried about the size but it turned out perfect. Once I fold it about 4 times its a perfect travel size bag about 1 foot of space inside. Its made sturdy so I really think ur getting the best bang for ur buck and what a convenience that u get the phone case as well. Already tried them both. N let me just say it is a luxury not needed to be worried about ur belongings getting wet when ur kayaking. Awesome product and price.
customer_reviews.author: Jtrujillo

customer_reviews.title: Great for paddle boarding!
customer_reviews.text: I tried out a friend's dry bag before I bought my own--and it's awesome! I love that the bag came with a phone bag as well. When we go paddle boarding for the day, we take everything with us, food, water, a microfiber towel, and cellphone. I haven't had any issues with it leaking and it seems to be very sturdy. I usually clip the buckle around my paddle board bungee and tuck the bag underneath. The phone bag works pretty well most of the time, as far as touch sensitivity. Sometimes it doesn't go through the plastic and you have to take it out to set it, but not a major issue. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: anjopear

customer_reviews.title: Does what it claims
customer_reviews.text: So I've never had one of these so I was unsure how the product would work. But this is the simplest quick fix solution to keeping your belongings safe and dry. I haven’t taken it on the boat yet but I have gave it some rigorous testing to be sure it will keep dry. I submerged it in water and squeezed the dickens out of it and jumbled it up and it was water tight. I’m very happy with it and love the color. I’m sure I won’t lose it
customer_reviews.author: @Landryslunches

customer_reviews.title: Want to protect your valuables on the water?
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 of these so my wife and I could bring our camera gear on our kayaks and keep them dry. Worked just as advertised, only issue I had is how hot they get inside if left in the sun. Have to put a towel inside and try to keep out of the sun. But would recommend these to anyone looking to keep their valuables dry on a boat.
customer_reviews.author: David J. OBrien

customer_reviews.title: It really works!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product because my son fell in the river with his phone on a fishing trip last month rendering it useless. After receiving the Unigear bag my family went on another fishing trip down the river and put all our phones and wallets in the large bag. Unfortunately, our boat flipped in the rapids, we lost much of our gear, and everyone was tossed out of the boat; but, my daughter had strapped the Unigear bag around her waist, so our phones and wallets were safe and DRY! Needless to say, we will be taking this bag with us on all our fishing trips.
customer_reviews.author: Farmer's Wife

customer_reviews.title: Great gear to head outdoors and conquer the elements
customer_reviews.text: I really just wanted the 5L bag for gear while out on the motorcycle so I consider the phone case a bonus. I filled both bags with water to test and they both held without a single leak. The phone bag lets me access the touchscreen without any trouble and I was even able to take clear photos. The gear bag is a no nonsense dry bag with a couple of attachment point for the strap so it can be slung across your back or shoulder.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie L.

customer_reviews.title: Indestructible
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag 4 years ago and it's still going strong after heavy use. I've taken it on 2 cruises and brought it with me on expeditions, countless road trips to the beach, and year round on the lake when boating and paddling. It still amazes me how much stuff I can pack into this bag. This thing is indestructible and has not once leaked water in. If I could give it 10 stars, I would!
customer_reviews.author: Clair

customer_reviews.title: Great for the lake
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it a few times on the lake. I don't have the guts to really test its water resistance, but I've taken it into the kayak with me, and my stuff has survived. The touch screen doesn't work for my phone, but.. Eh. Keeps me off my phone while on the lake. It gets really hot inside that bag. I had to stick my phone in the cooler after a bit cause it was overheating, but I'd rather that than have my phone fall into the lake.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie B

customer_reviews.title: Leaks. Seams exposed.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe a quality control issue, but the bag has exposed threads and leaks. Along the bottom there are areas where there is too much of the PVC material, and on two spots on the seams there is not enough and threads are exposed. See pictures. I put in a paper towel and rolled the top 5 times and put it in water. Tiny squeeze of the bag and bubbles are blowing out the bottom. Instant return.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Perf for odds and ends to stay dry
customer_reviews.text: Shipped in a day. It’s was a perf size on my float trip to attach to the canoe. Was able to put keys, 2 wallets, another phone, a hat, sunnies, snacks, and a small hand towel at the top so that whenever I first went in I was able to dry my hands before grabbing anything. It kept everything dry after a long day on the river.
customer_reviews.author: Now I know

customer_reviews.title: Must have for water sports!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag!!! Way easier to use than float boxes, zip locks, phone bags, etc. Just toss everything inside, roll it up, and snap closes. Tested it out kayaking last week before the public access points closed. Threw it out on the river and it floated. It sat in my wet kayak for 4 hrs. I opened and closed it a dozen times and still everything remained dry. I know this is my new “go to” for any water sports action!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie L. Healy

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be holding up fine
customer_reviews.text: I've done two kayak trips with the bag, it has worked well with no issues. I don't do anything crazy with it, I strap it in for storage. The backpack like straps are not really tough so I wouldn't go carrying it around full of stuff all day, the plastic clips are pretty small. But for dry bag storage it does the job well.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan B. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Durable construction
customer_reviews.text: Seems very durable compared to other dry sacks. Love the sling attachments. Feels like it will last forever. Used to keep gear dry on long camping trip w multiple river crossings.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!!
customer_reviews.text: This bag received great reviews and was highly recommended on several websites when I was researching top dry bags. It also has great reviews on Amazon. The 5L size is perfect for what we wanted. It seems well made and I have confirmed that both the bag and phone case are waterproof; I used paper towels in the phone case and clothes as well as a waterproof gps for weight in the dry bag- no water in either! We love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck_va

customer_reviews.title: Solid and reliable
customer_reviews.text: I used this while island hopping in El Nido, Palawan, and it was perfect. I loaded it with a towel, a camera, a drone, and some smaller things like keys and snacks. I was a little nervous taking it to water, but it kept all my stuff absolutely dry.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Palanca

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This almost got 5 stars because it did great on our outrigger snorkeling trip in Hawaii where we had to be jumping on and off an outrigger sail boat and keep things dry, but, it started fringing where you’d fold over the material and it was our very first use with it. You get what you pay for I guess. They should totally fix this and it would be a perfect bag! Otherwise, buy a bit more pricey for better quality and extended uses.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Doe

customer_reviews.title: High quality bag!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is solid! I purchased the smallest one and it is very sturdy. Seams are well secured and the material is thick. I had a 4L bag that got a hole in it from a different company so I purchased this one. I use it to carry phone, wallet, keys to the pool or in the boat. Although it’s stiff, I’m very impressed with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kalani

customer_reviews.title: Good dry bag
customer_reviews.text: This bag works great. Kept everything dry on a 2 hr kayak trip. I especially like the fact that this came with a cell phone bag as well. The only drawback for me was that I did not expect it to be as small as it was once the top was folded down. I was able to place a rolled up sweatshirt and small towel into the bag and had room for a just few small other items. But that is my fault. Probably should have purchased at least a 10 L bag if not larger.
customer_reviews.author: Alex on the Cape

customer_reviews.title: Great Waterproof Bag!
customer_reviews.text: This bag worked great for hiking, ATV and zip line. The fabric is totally water proof and thick with sturdy clips to close it up. The over the shoulder strap extended long enough to fit nicely and hung at a comfortable spot. The waterproof phone case was awesome! It clipped into a lanyard (provided) and kept my phone dry even in rain, pool and dirt and dust free on the trail. Touch screen worked great as well.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne H. English

customer_reviews.title: My kayak tipped and my things stayed dry!
customer_reviews.text: I got this bag for a kayak trip. I got the 10L green bag and it held 3 water bottles, 1 powerade, 2 sandwiches, 2 personal bags of chips, 2 apples, 2 packs of crackers, keys, and a phone (it was super full!). My kayak tipped once and everything was submerged but my stuff stayed dry! Just follow the instructions for folding the bag closed and it should work well.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: The quality was very nice. Definitely felt like no water would penetrate
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in preparation for my camping trip this past weekend. The quality was very nice. Definitely felt like no water would penetrate. However this was my first use with items inside. I packed my sleeping pad and bag in the bag to move them to the campsite easier. I was upset to see that the buckle had locked in a way that stuck. No matter what we tried we could not unbuckle it and I was forced to cut the bit of fabric connecting the bucket to the bag. And no I didn't buckle it "wrong".
customer_reviews.author: Kinsey Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: The bag was a little smaller than expected but it will work for me. I tested it out in the shower first with some paper and nothing got wet except when I opened the bad some water droplets rolled in from the outside. The phone case worried me because one of the clips broke off right away but it still didn’t let water in. I don’t think I would actually trust it with my phone though
customer_reviews.author: Taylor burkhalter

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I got this for kayaking but wanted to test it out first. I put a dry towel in the bag and tossed it in my pool. It floated really well and the bright green color should make it easy to spot when in the water. I pushed the opening under water and held it there while air bubbles came out. After about a minute I pulled the bag out and opened it to find that the towel was still dry.
customer_reviews.author: Minneyjb

customer_reviews.title: Great, buy it
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bag, I have yet to use it as it just arrived but it seems like really good quality i’m sure it’ll be water resistant. it’s a good size I got the 5L and it’ll definitely hold everything I need, snacks sunscreen extra clothes maybe a small towel. the phone case is great I have the iphone 7 plus and an otter box and my phone just fit inside.
customer_reviews.author: kaitlynn dodd

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: This dry bag works great when I am out paddle boarding. It comes with a strap so I can sling the bag over my shoulder while I am out paddling. The waterproof case for the phone was an added bonus. I dipped the bad in the water and it is actually waterproof, I feel safe enough to carry my camera in there when I am on the water.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Water was still able to leak in a little
customer_reviews.text: I took the water bag and phone case on a recent trip to Hawaii. I wanted to take pictures under water and keep my valuables with me. The phone case seems to hold up well. Due to the water pressure it was hard to press buttons underwater but at least no water leaked in. As far as the storage bag, some water was able to leak in. Not a huge amount but my wallet got a little damp. I suggest putting your items in a plastic bag and then putting it in the water storage bag. For the price it was still a good deal
customer_reviews.author: D V

customer_reviews.title: Ruined my $800 camera
customer_reviews.text: I used this bag for the first time last week while sailing in the BVIs; it leaked and ruined my $800 Nikon. I'm a diver and have used many bags in the past and never once had one leak. This one leaked while swimming into shore without even going under water!
customer_reviews.author: Brian O.

customer_reviews.title: Using it to keep the air and liquid in
customer_reviews.text: Nice bag. We use it for the opposite reason....trying to keep liquids and air in. We use it to shuttle full trash bags back home without stinking up the car or leaking liquids. It's the biggest bag I could find without spending a fortune, esp for trash, and holds about a 5gal bucket size amount of trash.
customer_reviews.author: tallhapa

customer_reviews.title: This bag does everything it is advertised to do.
customer_reviews.text: This bag exceeded my expectations. It is used for kayaking and stayed dry the entire 5 hour trip - and yes, it was in the river several times. It was able to carry food, drink, some ice, 2 bath towels, and some small items. The water proof phone bag that was included also worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: No time for delays
customer_reviews.text: The same day I received it was the same day rain was in the forecast. So perfect timing, that’s until I unboxed it. The plastic clip of the back strap (part that snaps to the strap) was broken on one side rendering the strap useless. Nevertheless it’s the size that I needed and with covid still being prevalent, I wanted to reduce the amount I carry into work. Ended up using a strap from one of my older ones to keep moving forward
customer_reviews.author: Tipten

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: Great dry bag! I still use it to this day. The dry bag fits at least one beach towel as well as a change of clothes and personal belongings. The phone case is just okay - it does the job though I’d keeping your phone dry it it gets splashed or rained on, it was a nice bonus to an awesome dry bag.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal A

customer_reviews.title: Pretty impressive.........
customer_reviews.text: This is surprisingly effective, and I was pretty skeptical. Good quality, can't even squeeze air out of it when sealed. Very happy with this purchase. Also, received an email from the owner of the company making sure that if anything was wrong to please let them know and they would make it right. Not necessary, but a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: DPAZ

customer_reviews.title: Unigear Dry Bag
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this bag for a river trip & was immediately impressed with the color & size. It kept all my items safe & dry. I did not use the phone case protector because it was a little bulky on my phone & the latches on the top were not the most user friendly. If you are looking for the perfect bag for the river this is it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: Best waterproof back I’ve purchased. My husband and I spend a lot of time in the water either in our kayaks or boat. This bag goes with us everywhere. It’s been submerged in creeks while holding our phones, wallets, keys and cameras and not once has it failed us and let water in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ultra dry is same price and better quality
customer_reviews.text: i bought this bag and an ultradry bag to compare to my sea to summit bag. the unigear top is inferior in that it isn't as stiff as the other two. i folded it over 3 times but my gear still got wet b/c the interior part of the rolling mechanism bent. the material is also less durable than the other two. i love the sea to summit bag, but for less than 1/2 the price i'd buy the ultra dry again and stay away from the unigear.
customer_reviews.author: mary

customer_reviews.title: Average bag - phone saver terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: Back up is ok. It got a scratch just the first day but the touch screen is the worst quality ever. First day got a hole in the bottom so water comes in. Not sure how it happens juat from leave it on the paddleboard but I guess the plastic os not very robust and durable. Awful
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Very large, great quality
customer_reviews.text: Great quality! It will great for what I need it for. Very large
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Good for emergencies.
customer_reviews.text: If you are going to the beach, the mountains, or just to a rainy place this is a must have. I had my doubts about this type of technology, I was afraid everything would get wet as soon as I jumped in the water, but all of it is easy to use, the bag and the phone case. Do yourself a favor and get one of these in case of an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Franx

customer_reviews.title: Too small for a day trip
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't decide between the 5L size & the 10L after reading many reviews. So I bought the 5L from this company & the 10L from another (since they didn't carry). Honestly you can't get much in the 5L. I'm much happier with the 10L size for a day trip & what I want to bring with me. Otherwise looks like a great product & would work well but I did end up returning.
customer_reviews.author: Allie M

customer_reviews.title: water resistant not water proof
customer_reviews.text: If you look at the questions section you will see where the manufacturer states that the bag is ipx4. That means the bag only "Protects from splashing water, no matter the direction". The title describes the bag as waterproof which is misleading. I would not have bought the bag if the title said the opening of the bag was only water resistant. The material maybe waterproof but you just roll the material on itself to create "the seal" for the opening which is by no means waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Allen J. Patenaude

customer_reviews.title: dry
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd one of these I've bought, because we like them so much. I actually still haven't totally submerged the bag, but for what we use it for it does the job! I keep a change of clothes for all our family in it along with some other items while we are on the lake. It's survived downpours and water splashes and kept the items dry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality Dry Bag that actually works !
customer_reviews.text: Great bag. Excellent quality and good price. I may buy another. Purchased a few so called dry bags from Dicks Sporting Goods and they all leak. Not this bag...heavy duty and built to last. Straps make it easy to carry also ! Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For The Pool Deck
customer_reviews.text: Keeps our towels, phones, eyeglass cases, iPod, Bluetooth headsets, Bluetooth speaker, radios, munchies, etc. dry on the pool deck while we are in the pool here in the Florida Panhandle. Especially handy to throw everything in during our almost daily mid-afternoon downpour. Provides an easy way to transport items from the house to outside with the shoulder strap and keep everything together in one place. Appears to be thick but flexible rubber with heavy duty stitching. Looks like it will last for years. With the top properly folded as per the instructions this bag is 100% waterproof (and it floats).
customer_reviews.author: EddieP

customer_reviews.title: Great little dry bag
customer_reviews.text: Holds Everything I need perfectly (wallet, keys and water) it's a lot easier than I thought it would be to get in and out of it. It makes a nice pillow when it has air in it! It's nice and bright so it's very easy to see.
customer_reviews.author: YmaAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Rugged and trust worthy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the 20 liter bag for a float trip. It was very spacious (clothes, snacks, sunscreen, phones, hats, etc) and seemed very durable. It rained on us a ton but everything was dry. It even was pushed in the water a few times. Stop looking and buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Arin

customer_reviews.title: Great size for just keys and cell phone.
customer_reviews.text: The size is nice for a cell phone and car keys. I like the long strap, I can attach my water bottle and lash it to the kayak or canoe. The long strap can act like a strap to carry it on your shoulder too. I like the quality and am considering getting the next two sizes for other items in my kayak.
customer_reviews.author: ckc59

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Son and I both got one each for BSA seabase and limited packing space. Works terrifically. Used it as carryon and to transport dry clothes to,beach from the boat. No,problems with waterproofing or fitting in overhead on plane. Straps are Great for running through airport or hiking to,beach. We plan to use them,for the spring kayak trip. Handle,is tough and well stitched.
customer_reviews.author: Sabot

customer_reviews.title: Not a heavy duty waterproof bag
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this water proof bag to keep my things dry while I Jetski, followed instruction on use. definitely not jetski waterproof, everything was soaked. Left it to air out in the truck bed a couple days but the sun faded the neon color right away.
customer_reviews.author: S.G.A

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bag!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 5L bag and was surprised at just how much it could hold. Was able to get in multiple cell phones, go pro camera, couple bottles of water and a beach towel without issue. Haven't done a dunk test but used this on a jet ski and everything stayed dry so I would call it a win.
customer_reviews.author: James Nation

customer_reviews.title: It arrived as expected and so far we like it although we haven't used it on the boat ...
customer_reviews.text: It arrived as expected and so far we like it although we haven't used it on the boat yet. We bought the 10L so we could use it to put all our documents in when we dinghy from the boat to customs clearance on the islands. The size of the bag is perfect for that. I would have given 5 stars, but the included phone case is too small for my Samsung Galaxy, so it's not really 'universal'.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Good if minimal splashing, exposure to water
customer_reviews.text: We used this bag on a tubing trip and it kept our phones and keys mostly dry. There was a little moisture at the top of the bag even though I rolled it more than the recommended amount (5 times). The bag was in a raft and never resting on the river. The size and color are great, and it's easily collapsible for storing.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Gilledo

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Satisfy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my trip to Hawaii and it turned out helping me a lot when I was playing water sport. One thing that I may not like is the plastic smell when it first arrived at my apt. But once you let it out and breath, it is better
customer_reviews.author: Andy L.

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars will be buying the bigger sizes.
customer_reviews.text: This product is exactly what it states in the description. The water proof bag fits my galaxy s10 with plenty of space for the bigger phones. I had no issue using my phone through the case so it is easily used when it's in the bag. The 5l water proof bag has very durable stitching and has proven to keep water out. I tested both the items sitting in the shower and the bathtub. I will be buying the bigger versions of the product and am very happy with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Justin C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the beach or boating!
customer_reviews.text: This dry bag is very high quality and is perfect for toting things to the beach or on a boat. This size is perfect for toting all of our sunscreen. I plan to buy another to keep our valuables. When closed, it forms its own handle, so you don't even need the included strap. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: M. Walter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Dry Bag
customer_reviews.text: This dry bag is awesome! It is perfect for adventuring, and it is really reassuring to know that your stuff is protected. The little dry bag for your phone is also very convenient. Because it creates a seal to keep moisture out, air gets trapped in the little phone bag, making it a little difficult to access the screen. However, this is such a minor issue. The price, quality and color are all totally awesome, love this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Adrie

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and very practical
customer_reviews.text: The dry bag does exactly what it’s supposed to do. I bought the 30L bag. I didn’t submerge the bag but just getting water splashed on the bag, all the content inside stayed dry. What I really liked was the cell phone bag. With the iPhone 7 Plus you can NOT physically press the home button through the bag so make sure to enable the soft home button before you use the bag. Otherwise the bags was super helpful on the lake when we got lost on a canoe and had to use google maps. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: gethanga

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly SUCH a good product for the price. I love finding things like this on amazon because i don’t have to go searching store to store to find something that is probably lower quality. 10/10 recommend.
customer_reviews.author: marcus childs

customer_reviews.title: and product is fantastic! He was thrilled
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bag for my boyfriend for Christmas. Fast shipping, and product is fantastic! He was thrilled. Can't wait to use it this summer on the boat and floating! Very durable feeling. Perfect size for all personal belongings. Easy to carry and close!
customer_reviews.author: maggiemae.

customer_reviews.title: Came with holes
customer_reviews.text: Was looking forward to getting this, opened it up, and immediately saw holes like it had been stapled, so I’m very disappointed. I wasn’t planning on using this for diving or anything and submerging it, and duct tape could probably work okay, but this is unacceptable for brand new. Will be returning for a refund. Edit: Changed review from 1 to 3 stars because the seller refunded me even before I was able to send back the item. Based on the other reviews, I can believe my bag having holes was unusual and I appreciate the customer service being so responsive
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Bag awesome, phone case just okay...
customer_reviews.text: Dry bag is very nice, great quality. Thick and rugged. Phone case is okay, iPhone screen kept staying on, like I was touching it, just from contact with the inside of case, so I guess that's not very good for battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Fullerton

customer_reviews.title: Phone bag worked for 7 days in the ocean!
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the phone bag that comes with the dry bag. We haven't had any issues with the dry bag but haven't really put it to the test. The waterproof phone bag, however, I can 100% guarantee works. I lost my phone while swimming at the beach and because visibility was so poor, I couldn't find it. A week later, another snorkeler spotted my phone, on the ocean floor 8 feet deep, and rescued it. My phone was completely dry and in perfect condition after 7 days underwater, all because of this bag. I highly recommend it!!
customer_reviews.author: LBELBLIE

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price (5&40 liter bags) Stiff
customer_reviews.text: The dry bag is fine, but may need 4 half turns to seal well. The individual phone bag is sturdy enough and fits my Samsung J7 fine. The 5 liter bag was too small to hold my cell phone. Have a 10 liter on the way. Also got the 40 liter bag. Hasn't been used beyond packing it full to check comfort. It seems quite nice.
customer_reviews.author: willyp00

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly sized
customer_reviews.text: This bag is the size I needed. Originally ordered the 5L and although it held enough it didn't hold it all so I upgraded. A few odd things though, same brand and color but the material on the 10L felt thinner for some reason. The clip was also different - seemed cheaper and has already gotten stuck on one side a few times (maybe it needs to break in?). Also the strap seemed cheaper. Not sure if it's just me - hoping for the best and that this bag will last me a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen B.

customer_reviews.title: Just didn’t fit my needs
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the smallest bag but it was still too large for my purpose (canoeing). I also didn’t feel it was secure with the way the top had to be rolled down to make it waterproof. Nicely made and heavy material though
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a cruise/excursions
customer_reviews.text: This bag was perfect for our cruise. We used it for our excursions once we got off the ship. The material was nice because it could get wet, sandy, or have suntan lotion on it and it was not a concern. The bag also came in handy when we were walking around on busy streets. Since the top folds over to make it waterproof, it was unlikely that someone would be able to get in/undo and steal something while we were wearing it over our shoulder/back. We will defiantly be using this for boating, jet skiing, and beaching this summer! Would highly recommend and would defiantly purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a birthday present for my husband and we took it kayaking the next day. It worked great for a couple of towels, sunblock, and our phones and wallets. We didn't submerge it in the water so as far as I know it will float and not take on water.
customer_reviews.author: JackieSudduth

customer_reviews.title: Keeps your phone dry!
customer_reviews.text: Great little bag! I used the Waterproof phone pouch in my hot tub. My phone still took pics and did not get wet. We have not when on a hike, due to rain, but I wore it one day at work. It’s an awesome little bag and easy to carry.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lance Draper

customer_reviews.title: Phone bag was sealed shut..
customer_reviews.text: Bag was great, however the included phone case was sealed shut. After opening the top black handle part the bag was heat sealed. Bummed cause I was excited about this to protect my phone..
customer_reviews.author: Libby

customer_reviews.title: Good for keeping snacks from the elements
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son to carry stuff in while he’s hunting in his tree stand. The majority of the time it’s either raining or snowing and his snacks get wet. He said his stuff did get a bit wet but he may have not rolled it up enough. This is the only reason for not giving it 5*. It it’s a very nice quality bag so I’m blaming user error on the 18 year old boy!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Looks good
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it in the water yet. It's been too cold. It looks great and appears to be very durable. I like it a lot and it was what I was looking for... I will update after I use it
customer_reviews.author: Theresa T

customer_reviews.title: Best Dry Bag ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Dry Bag I’ve bought on Amazon. My happy place is our home at the river. I’ve got back issues, so I’m constantly floating when not in the boat. I’ve got the larger dry bags on the boat and this smaller one I keep on the back of my boat. It holds my phone and lip sun protection. Plus what ever my kids throw in.. lol I don’t have to worry about anything getting wet, because these bags rock!! Only product I’ll buy to keep my things dry..
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Super happy with this bag. I got the 30L which is more than enough space to hold a towel, water bottle, etc. It also comes with a nifty little waterproof phone case, which also works great! I was able to take pictures and access my phone while it was in the case. I took this bag whitewater rafting, and everything inside stayed bone dry.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

product_meta.title: Unigear Dry Bag Waterproof, Floating and Lightweight Bags for Kayaking, Boating, Fishing, Swimming and Camping with Waterproof Phone Case
product_meta.description:
PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Is Discontinued By Manufacturer :No
 * Product Dimensions :14.17 x 22.83 x 8.86 inches; 12.64 Ounces
 * Date First Available :July 2, 2015
 * Manufacturer :Unigear
 * ASIN :B010SF8SX2

 * Amazon Best Sellers Rank: #2,743 in Sports & Outdoors (See Top 100 in Sports & Outdoors)  *  #8 inMarine Dry Bags 
   
   

 * Customer Reviews:4.7 out of 5 stars3,668 ratings
feature_bullets: 100% WATERPROOF: Made of stiff 500D PVC material and designed with roll-top closure, Unigear waterproof bag protects your phones, camera, clothes, documents and snacks from Water, Sand, Dust and Dirt

ANTI LEAK AND ANTI TEAR: Features fully welded seams by high-frequency tech, our dry sack provides a stronger and more durably waterproof construction. Abrasion resistant for long lasting, perfect for boating, fishing, paddling, swimming and hiking

EASY AND COMFORTABLE TO CARRY: Comes with a single strap for 2L/5L/10L/20L dry bags, two straps for 30L and 40L waterproof backpack.Extra-long and adjustable for convenient carry & comfort. Multi styles to carry for better looking. Reinforce the stress point of D-rings with double sewing, no ripping again even for heavy load

VERSATILE AND DURABLE: You can leave the dry bag float on the water during river trip or other water sporting, no more worry about your items getting wet. The buckle and D-rings are upgraded with POM material, stronger than other traditional buckle. It will not break for frequent use
AFTER-SALES SERVICE: If you meet any quality problems of our dry bags, please simply e-mail us the problem at any time, and we will offer you a solution as soon as possible.
